basics.name: Chris Eaves-Kohlbrenner
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Chris is a software engineer based in NYC. He brings a full-stack approach to solving technology problems, with strengths in JavaScript, functional programming, data visualization, and UI development.

work.summary: RedOwl’s security analytics enable risk management teams to proactively monitor and mitigate suspicious human activity inside the enterprise.
highlights: Build UI features and components for RedOwl’s data analytics application (technologies used: React, Redux, Webpack, Immutable.js, QUnit/Karma, D3, Node, Ember, PostgreSQL).
Develop custom data visualizations (using D3.js) based on customer requests, including heatmaps and data analyses over time.
Contribute to backend service by creating server endpoints to enable data retrieval/manipulation (technologies used: Java, ElasticSearch).
Collaborate with Product Development team to integrate designs and product feedback into technical specs and implementation.

work.summary: ScriptEd equips students in under-resourced schools with the fundamental coding skills and professional experiences that together create access to careers in technology. For two school years, I've volunteered as a classroom teacher in East Harlem.
highlights: Volunteer in classroom of an East Harlem high school twice per week, teaching introductory computer science.
Communicate HTML, CSS, and JavaScript concepts in order to complete projects, including personal websites, web design, and API integration.

work.summary: The TTUS Office of Research Commercialization works with researchers and business partners to translate research discoveries into commercial applications and successfully bring them to the marketplace.
highlights: Interfaced with Texas Tech University researchers to assess commercial potential of ideas and inventions.
Strategized on local and regional economic development initiatives.
Conducted due diligence and maintained deal flow relationships with companies applying for Texas Emerging Technology Fund investment.

work.summary: Seedco is a national nonprofit organization that advances economic opportunity for people, businesses and communities in need.
highlights: Counseled low-income and unemployed clients about accessing public benefits.
Managed a Volunteer Income Tax Assistance (VITA) program as site coordinator and tax preparer.
Collaborated with health insurance and food stamps specialists to create awareness of benefits availability.

work.summary: Habitat For Humanity Egypt is a national affiliate of Habitat for Humanity, envisioning a country without poverty housing.
highlights: Designed and developed a website (habitategypt.org) to reach potential donors and volunteers.
Researched and edited grant proposals to Egyptian and international corporate and philanthropic donors.
Coordinated with Egyptian and American coworkers. Communicated with donors and supporters by writing electronic newsletters and monthly thank you letters.

volunteer.summary: ScriptEd equips students in under-resourced schools with the fundamental coding skills and professional experiences that together create access to careers in technology. For two school years, I've volunteered as a classroom teacher in East Harlem.
